title: How to Draw Skylanders

steps.headline: Draw a large, upright, egg-like circle at the center of the page.
Draw a pair of slightly curved, parallel horizontal lines near the top of the circle.
Draw a third horizontal line in between the initial horizontal lines.
steps.description: These lines will serve as a guide later where to place Trigger Happy's eyes.

steps.headline: Draw two small, upright ovals--one on the left and the other at the right.
steps.description: Place them near but not touching the main egg-like circle. Their base level should also be at least in line with the lowest of the horizontal lines you've drawn earlier. Connect the base of these little ovals to the side of the main circle by a curved line.

steps.headline: Draw a pair of horizontally stretched ovals beneath the main circle.
steps.description: Connect these with the main circle to be a guideline for Trigger Happy's legs.

steps.headline: Using the horizontal guide lines, draw Trigger Happy's eyes.
steps.description: Draw a guide line for the mouth.

steps.headline: Using mouth guide line, make something that looks like a leaf, of which the tip of this "leaf" would be pointing upward to depict a smile.
steps.description: In it, draw Trigger Happy's sharp upper and lower teeth. Make sure the mouth is open enough and let its long tongue curve out.

steps.headline: Start drawing Trigger Happy's body outline.
Draw a pair of long, flame-like ears.
steps.description: In between them, draw two standing hair fringe on top of the main circle, which will look something like a curvy capital letter "M."

steps.headline: Draw Trigger Happy's pistols in a way that resembles a regular plastic milk jug.
Add details on Trigger Happy's eyes and pistols.
Erase unnecessary lines.
Add more "furry" details
Color the drawing as desired.
Near the topmost and center of the paper, draw a circle for her head.
Below the circle, draw a curved spade shape for the chin and jaws.
Beneath these, draw a polygon and stick figure to represent her torso and arms.
steps.description: Place small circles where her shoulders are and place a medium sized octagon where her hands should be. Since her legs cannot be seen, draw a single polygon beneath the hip level of the torso.

steps.headline: Draw a vertical line at the center of the entire head and chin part.
steps.description: Make three parallel horizontal lines that will intersect their middle with the vertical line. This will be the lines to guide the placement of Hex's facial features.

steps.headline: Using these line guides, draw Hex's large almond-like eyes.
steps.description: Draw the lines for her eyebrows, nose and lips.

steps.headline: Begin tracing the outline of Hex's body.
steps.description: Her headpiece would resemble open bird wings and her costume would be a flowing long dress. She also have pointy shoulder protectors.

steps.headline: Add details on her body and costume.
Erase unnecessary lines.
Thicken the outline of her eyes.

text: Trigger Happy Draw a large, upright, egg-like circle at the center of the page.  Draw a pair of slightly curved, parallel horizontal lines near the top of the circle.  Draw a third horizontal line in between the initial horizontal lines. These lines will serve as a guide later where to place Trigger Happy's eyes. Draw two small, upright ovals--one on the left and the other at the right. Place them near but not touching the main egg-like circle. Their base level should also be at least in line with the lowest of the horizontal lines you've drawn earlier. Connect the base of these little ovals to the side of the main circle by a curved line. Draw a pair of horizontally stretched ovals beneath the main circle. Connect these with the main circle to be a guideline for Trigger Happy's legs. Using the horizontal guide lines, draw Trigger Happy's eyes. Draw a guide line for the mouth. Using mouth guide line, make something that looks like a leaf, of which the tip of this "leaf" would be pointing upward to depict a smile. In it, draw Trigger Happy's sharp upper and lower teeth. Make sure the mouth is open enough and let its long tongue curve out. Start drawing Trigger Happy's body outline. Draw hand details. Draw a pair of long, flame-like ears. In between them, draw two standing hair fringe on top of the main circle, which will look something like a curvy capital letter "M." Draw Trigger Happy's pistols in a way that resembles a regular plastic milk jug.  Add details on Trigger Happy's eyes and pistols.  Erase unnecessary lines.  Add more "furry" details  Color the drawing as desired.  Hex Near the topmost and center of the paper, draw a circle for her head.  Below the circle, draw a curved spade shape for the chin and jaws.  Beneath these, draw a polygon and stick figure to represent her torso and arms. Place small circles where her shoulders are and place a medium sized octagon where her hands should be. Since her legs cannot be seen, draw a single polygon beneath the hip level of the torso. Draw a vertical line at the center of the entire head and chin part. Make three parallel horizontal lines that will intersect their middle with the vertical line. This will be the lines to guide the placement of Hex's facial features. Using these line guides, draw Hex's large almond-like eyes. Draw the lines for her eyebrows, nose and lips. Begin tracing the outline of Hex's body. Her headpiece would resemble open bird wings and her costume would be a flowing long dress. She also have pointy shoulder protectors. Add details on her body and costume.  Erase unnecessary lines. Add details to her headpiece. Thicken the outline of her eyes. Color the drawing as desired.
